headline.main: Of Canadians, Tourism, and Free Parties as Ads

docs.lead_paragraph: Canadian Tourism Commission offered free food and drink on a Midtown rooftop garden that is rarely open to the public to entice New Yorkers to spend their summer vacations up north.

docs.abstract: Sen James S Cafiero offers bill to send half of sales tax New Jersey collects in Wildwoods back to Greater Wildwoods Tourism Improvement and Development Authority to help pay for new minor league baseball stadium and convention center (NJ Daily Briefing) (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: If you build it, they may come, but to build it you have to tax them first, officials in North Wildwood say. Senator James S. Cafiero, Republican of North Wildwood, introduced a bill last Thursday that would send half of the sales tax the state collects in the Wildwoods back to the Greater Wildwoods Tourism Improvment and Development Authority to help pay for a new baseball stadium and convention center. Mr. Cafiero said the measure would send $3.75 million a year to the towns.

headline.print_headline: Israeli Tourism Moved To South During Conflict
headline.main: Israeli Tourism Moved to South During Conflict

docs.lead_paragraph: Israeli tourism just moved south during the fighting. Jerusalem, Tel Aviv and the southern city of Eilat were the recipients of an unexpected travel boom.

headline.print_headline: Turkey Takes the Long View on Tourism
headline.main: Tourism to Turkey: Challenges and Hope

docs.abstract: Tourism in Turkey spirals to new lows following slew of terror attacks yet tour companies and country's official remain optimistic that tides will turn for better in second half of 2016.
docs.lead_paragraph: Despite the bleak situation, there may be reasons to be optimistic about the country’s longer-term prospects as a vacation destination.
docs.snippet: Despite the bleak situation, there may be reasons to be optimistic about the country’s longer-term prospects as a vacation destination....

headline.print_headline: Strife Chokes Chinese Tourism to Vietnam
headline.main: China Tensions Choke Off Tourism to Vietnam

docs.abstract: Chinese accounted for roughly a million foreign visitors to Vietnam in the first half of 2014; arrivals from the Chinese mainland fell about 30 percent in June following anti-Chinese riots over oil rig in South China Sea.
docs.lead_paragraph: Chinese accounted for roughly a million foreign visitors to Vietnam in the first half of the year. But in June, arrivals from the Chinese mainland fell about 30 percent.

headline.print_headline: Playing Politics? Chinese Tourism Under Scrutiny as Lunar New Year Nears
headline.main: Playing Politics? Chinese Tourism Under Scrutiny as Lunar New Year Nears

docs.lead_paragraph: With 6 million Chinese tourists expected to travel abroad over the Lunar New Year break, China's Jan. 27 to Feb. 2 holiday is crucial for Taiwan tour agency operator Li Chi-yueh, who relies on mainland visitors for a third of his revenue.
